CONCAT (FUN)
CONCAT (FUN)
Â¶
FUNCTION CONCAT : STRING(255)
Concatenates two strings
CONCAT(STR1,STR2)
means: Connect
STR1
and
STR2
to a single string
STR1STR2
.
(* Example declaration *)
VarSTRING1
:
STRING
;
(* Example in ST , result is 'SUSIWILLI' *)
VarSTRING1
:=
CONCAT
(
'SUSI'
,
'WILLI'
);
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Comment
Return
CONCAT
STRING(255)
Concatenated string, max. 255 characters. If the result doesnât fit into these 255 bytes, it will be silently truncated. No error is produced.
Input
STR1
STRING(255)
String 1 to be concatenated, max. 255 characters
STR2
STRING(255)
String 2 to be concatenated, max. 255 characters
